meanings.definition: Small insects that live in colonies and are known for their hard work and organization.
meanings.sent1: The ants worked together to build their anthill.
meanings.sent2: I saw a line of ants carrying food back to their nest.
meanings.sent3: The ants were so organized that they finished their task in no time.
meanings.sent4: Watching the ants collaborate felt like observing a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the ants marching in perfect order was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nervousness or restlessness.
meanings.sent1: She felt ants in her stomach before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The anticipation of the exam gave him ants.
meanings.sent3: The ants in her stomach made her fidget in her seat.
meanings.sent4: The ants of anxiety crawled through his mind as he waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of ants before a performance is common among many people.

meanings.sent1: He may be short, but he's an ant when it comes to getting things done.
meanings.sent2: She's the little ant who always finishes her tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant surprised everyone with her efficiency at work.
meanings.sent4: She proved to be a powerhouse, a true ant in the team.
meanings.sent5: Despite his size, he was the hardest worker in the group, a true ant.
